=== Recent roles (2015–present) === In 2015, Bullock provided the voice of the villain in the animated film ''[[Minions (film)|Minions]]'', which became her highest-grossing film to date with over US$1.1 billion worldwide,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=minions.htm%5D|title=Box Office Mojo – Movie Index, A-Z|website=''boxofficemojo.com''}}</ref> and she executive produced and starred, as a political consultant hired to help win a Bolivian presidential election, in the drama ''[[Our Brand Is Crisis (2015 film)|Our Brand Is Crisis]]'', based on the [[Our Brand Is Crisis (2005 film)|2005 documentary film of the same name]] by Rachel Boynton. Upon the film's release, which was a critical and commercial flop,<ref>https://deadline.com/2015/11/sandra-bullock-our-brand-is-crisis-hollywood-stars-warner-bros-1201603995/</ref> she took another sabbatical from film. Bullock returned in an all-female spin-off of the ''Ocean's Eleven'' franchise, ''[[Ocean's 8]]'' (2018), which was directed by [[Gary Ross]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/10/30/sandra-bullock-oceans-eleven|title=Ocean's 11: Sandra Bullock will lead an all-female reboot}}</ref> playing Debbie Ocean, the sister of [[Danny Ocean (character)|Danny Ocean]], who plan a sophisticated heist of the annual [[Met Gala]] in New York City. The film was a commercial success, grossing US$296.9 million globally.<ref>https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=wbeventfilm2018c.htm</ref>
Bullock played Malorie, a woman who must find a way to guide herself and her children to safety despite the potential threat from an unseen adversary, in the [[Netflix]] post-apocalyptic horror film ''[[Bird Box (film)|Bird Box]]'' (also 2018), the adaptation of [[Josh Malerman]]’s [[Bird Box|novel of the same name]], directed by [[Susanne Bier]]. For her performance, the actress has received universal acclaim.<ref>{{cite web|last1=|first1=|title=Sandra Bullock is a Bright Spot in ‘Bird Box’|url=https://https://www.slashfilm.com|publisher=Slash Film|accessdate=November 13, 2018}}</ref> ''Variety'' found her to be "wonderfully self-resilient",<ref>{{cite web|last1=Debruge|first1=Peter|title=Sandra Bullock in ‘Bird Box’|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/festivals/bird-box-review-sandra-bullock-netflix-1203027004/|publisher=Variety|accessdate=November 13, 2018}}</ref> while ''[[TheWrap]]'' described her as “brilliant [...] her performance was equally terrifying and fascinating to watch.“<ref>{{cite web|last1=Machado|first1=Yolanda|title=Sandra Bullock Battles Her Fears in Thoughtful Thriller|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/festivals/bird-box-review-sandra-bullock-netflix-1203027004/|publisher=The Wrap|accessdate=November 13, 2018}}</ref> {{As of|2018|May}}, Bullock's films have grossed over US$5.3 billion worldwide,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.the-numbers.com/people/worldwide-records/top-grossing-leading-stars |title=Top 100 stars in leading roles at the worldwide box office |website=The Numbers |publisher=Nash Information Services |accessdate=May 4, 2017}}</ref> and her total domestic gross stands at over US$2.6 billion.<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.the-numbers.com/people/records/top-grossing-leading-stars|title=Top 100 stars in leading roles at the domestic box office |website=The Numbers |publisher=Nash Information Services |accessdate=May 4, 2017}}</ref>
==Public image== Since her acting debut, Bullock has been dubbed "America's sweetheart" in the media due to her "friendly and direct and so unpretentious" nature.<ref>{{cite news| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/08/movies/sandra-bullock-may-be-hollywoods-gutsiest-a-list-actress.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0|title =Following Her Fears to Greater Heights | work =The New York Times|date=September 6, 2013|accessdate=July 25, 2014}}</ref> [[File:Sandra Bullocks Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.JPG|thumb|left|upright|Bullock's star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]]]] She was selected as one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine's 50 Most Beautiful People in the World in 1996<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20122069,00.html|title=Beautiful Through the Years|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=May 12, 1997|volume=47|issue=18|accessdate=October 20, 2015}}</ref> and 1999,<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20128102,00.html|title=The 50 Most Beautiful People in the World 1999|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=May 10, 1999|volume=51|issue=17|accessdate=October 20, 2015}}</ref> and was also ranked No. 58 in ''[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]]'' magazine's Top 100 Movie Stars of All Time list.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.amiannoying.com/(S(izv3y1y1ez44qauzzgsprsgg))/collection.aspx?collection=47|title=AmIAnnoying.com – Empire Magazine's Top 100 Movie Stars [1997]|website=''amiannoying.com''|access-date=24 February 2018}}</ref> On March 24, 2005, Bullock received a [[List of actors with Hollywood Walk of Fame motion picture stars|motion pictures star]] on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] at 6801 [[Hollywood Boulevard]] in Hollywood.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://projects.latimes.com/hollywood/star-walk/sandra-bullock/|title=Sandra Bullock|last=Goldstein|first=Gary|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=February 19, 2010|accessdate=October 20, 2015}}</ref>
In 2010, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine included Bullock in its annual [[Time 100|''TIME'' 100]] as one of the "Most Influential People in the World."<ref>{{cite news|title=The 2010 TIME 100: Sandra bullock|url=http://content.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1984685_1984940_1985519,00.html|accessdate=July 24, 2014|work=Time|date=April 29, 2010}}</ref> Bullock was selected by ''People'' magazine as its 2010 Woman of the Year<ref>{{cite news|url = http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20449594,00.html|newspaper = People|volume = 74|issue = 24|date = December 27, 2010|accessdate =March 7, 2011 | first = Chris|last = Pizzello|pages = 80–81|title = Sandra Bullock: Woman of the Year}}</ref> and ranked No. 12 on ''People''{{'}}s Most Beautiful 2011 list.<ref>{{cite web|title=PEOPLE's Most Beautiful 2011|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/gallery/0,,20360857_20481337,00.html#20936773|work=People|accessdate=August 11, 2011|date=April 13, 2011}}</ref>
In September 2013, Bullock joined other Hollywood legends at the [[Grauman's Chinese Theatre|TCL Chinese Theatre]] on Hollywood Boulevard by making imprints of her hand- and footprints in cement in the theater's forecourt.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock enshrined in Hollywood history|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/sandra-bullock-enshrined-in-hollywood-history/|accessdate=July 25, 2014|publisher=CBS News|date=September 26, 2013}}</ref> In November 2013, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' named Bullock among the most powerful women in entertainment,<ref>{{cite web|title=The Hollywood Reporter's 2013 Women in Entertainment Power 100|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/list/hollywood-reporters-2013-women-entertainment-power-100-664497|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=July 24, 2014}}</ref> and she was also named ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''{{'}}s Entertainer of the Year due to her success with ''The Heat'' and ''Gravity''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2013/11/25/entertainers-of-the-year-sandra-bullock|title=This Week's Cover: Our Entertainers of the Year!|work=Entertainment Weekly|date=November 25, 2013}}</ref>
In 2014, Bullock ranked No. 2 on ''[[Forbes]]''{{'}} list of most powerful actresses<ref>{{cite web|title=Celeb 2014: Most Powerful Actresses|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45ejlfg/sandra-bullock-22/|work=Forbes|accessdate=July 24, 2014}}</ref> and was honored with the Decade of Hotness Award by [[Guys Choice|Spike Guys' Choice Awards]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock Receives Decade of Hotness Award From Her 3 Favorite Men|url=https://celebrity.yahoo.com/blogs/yahoo-celebrity/sandra-bullock-receives-decade-of-hotness-award-from-her-3-favorite-men-164725782.html|accessdate=July 25, 2014|publisher=Yahoo|date=June 8, 2014}}</ref> In 2015, she was named "[[People (magazine)#People Magazine's 100 Most Beautiful People|The Most Beautiful Woman]]" by ''[[People (magazine)|People]].''<ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock is PEOPLE's World's Most Beautiful Woman|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/04/22/sandra-bullock-people-most-beautiful-woman|accessdate=August 7, 2015|publisher=Entertainment weekly}}</ref>
== Business ventures == Bullock owns a production company, Fortis Films. She was an executive producer of the ''[[George Lopez (TV series)|George Lopez]]'' sitcom (co-produced with [[Robert Borden (TV producer)|Robert Borden]] and [[Bruce Helford]]), which garnered a syndication deal that banked her some US$10 million.<ref>{{cite news|last=Hebert|first=Katie Kuehner|title=And the Award for Best Entrepreneur Goes to Sandra Bullock|url=http://upstart.bizjournals.com/news/wire/2010/03/10/and-the-award-for-best-entrepreneur-goes-to-sandra-bullock.html?page=all|accessdate=August 30, 2013|date=March 10, 2010}}</ref> Bullock tried to produce a film based on [[F.X. Toole]]'s short story ''Million-Dollar Baby'', but could not interest the studios in a female boxing drama. The story was eventually adapted and directed by [[Clint Eastwood]] as the [[Academy Awards|Oscar]]-winning film, ''[[Million Dollar Baby]]'' (2004).<ref>{{cite news|title=Bullock Fires Back at Million Dollar Baby Reports|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news-article/bullock-fires-back-at-million-dollar-baby-reports|accessdate=August 30, 2013|publisher=[[Contactmusic.com]]|date=March 8, 2005}}</ref> Fortis Films also produced ''[[All About Steve]]'' which was released in September 2009. Her father, John Bullock, is the company's CEO,<ref>{{cite web|title=Sandra Bullock |publisher=[[Yahoo!]] |url=https://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800018970/bio |accessdate=February 5, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061130082742/http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800018970/bio |archivedate=November 30, 2006}}</ref> and her sister, Gesine Bullock-Prado, is the former president.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bullock's prod'n co. a 'learning experience'|url=https://variety.com/2001/film/news/fortis-fortifies-future-deals-1117794813/|accessdate=October 18, 2014|work=Variety}}</ref>
In November 2006, Bullock founded an [[Austin, Texas]] restaurant, Bess Bistro, located on West 6th Street.<ref>{{cite news|title=Drop in Sandra Bullock's Austin Restaurants |url=http://bristolsquare.myaptportal.com/around-town/drop-in-sandra-bullocks-austin-restaurants/ |accessdate=August 30, 2013 |date=July 25, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130805072157/http://bristolsquare.myaptportal.com/around-town/drop-in-sandra-bullocks-austin-restaurants/ |archivedate=August 5, 2013}}</ref> She later opened another business, Walton's Fancy and Staple, across the street in a building she extensively renovated. Walton's is a bakery, upscale restaurant and floral shop that also offers services including event planning.<ref>{{cite news|title=Walton's Fancy and Staple|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/food/2009-07-17/waltons-fancy-and-staple/|accessdate=August 30, 2013|newspaper=[[The Austin Chronicle]]|date=July 17, 2009}}</ref> After almost nine years in business, Bess Bistro closed on September 20, 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.kvue.com/story/life/food/2015/09/08/sandra-bullocks-popular-austin-bistro-closing-its-doors/71885108/|title=Sandra Bullock's popular Austin bistro closing its doors|last=Raney|first=Nicole|publisher=[[KVUE]]|date=September 8, 2015|accessdate=January 24, 2016}}</ref>
== Philanthropy == Bullock has been a public supporter of the [[American Red Cross]], having donated US$1 million to the organization at least five times. Her first public donation of that amount was to the Red Cross's [[Financial assistance following the September 11 attacks|Liberty Disaster Relief Fund]]. Three years later, she sent money in [[Humanitarian response to the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake|response to the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunamis]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2005/SHOWBIZ/Movies/01/03/tsunami.bullock.ap/index.html |publisher=CNN |title=Sandra Bullock donates $1 mil for tsunami |date=January 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050107041343/http://www.cnn.com/2005/SHOWBIZ/Movies/01/03/tsunami.bullock.ap/index.html |archivedate=January 7, 2005}}</ref> In 2010, she donated US$1 million to relief efforts in Haiti following the [[2010 Haiti earthquake|Haiti earthquake]], and again donated the same amount following the [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/celebrity.news.gossip/03/17/bullock.japan.donation/index.html?hpt=T2|publisher=CNN|title=Sandra Bullock sends million for Japan | date=March 18, 2011}}</ref> In 2017, she donated US$1 million to support Red Cross relief efforts for Hurricane Harvey in Texas.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Heyman|first1=J.D.|title=Sandra Bullock Donates $1 Million to Help Hurricane Relief Effort|url=http://people.com/human-interest/sandra-bullock-donates-1-million-hurricane-relief-effort/|website=People|accessdate=August 31, 2017}}</ref>
Along with other stars, Bullock did a [[public service announcement]] urging people to sign a petition for clean-up efforts of the [[Deepwater Horizon oil spill|oil spill]] in the [[Gulf of Mexico]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebritynews/news/sandra-bullock-urges-fans-to-help-in-gulf-oil-spill-2010207 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100723151628/http://www.usmagazine.com/celebritynews/news/sandra-bullock-urges-fans-to-help-in-gulf-oil-spill-2010207 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 23, 2010 |title=Sandra Bullock Urges Fans to Help in Gulf Oil Spill |work=Us Weekly |df=}}</ref> Bullock backs the Texas non-profit organization The Kindred Life Foundation, Inc., and in late 2008 joined other top celebrities in supporting the work of KLF's founder and CEO Amos Ramirez. At a fundraising gala for the organization, Bullock said, "Amos has led many efforts across our nation that have helped families that are in need. Our country needs more organizations that are committed to the service that Kindred Life is."<ref>{{cite news|title=Giving Hearts of Hollywood|url=http://www.listal.com/list/not-just-another-pretty-face|accessdate=June 20, 2013|publisher=listal.com}}</ref>
In 2012, Bullock was inducted into the Warren Easton Hall of Fame for her donations to charities, and in 2013 was honored with the [[People's Choice Awards#Special|Favorite Humanitarian Award]] at the [[39th People's Choice Awards]] in 2013 for her contributions to New Orleans' [[Warren Easton High School]], which was severely damaged by 2005's [[Hurricane Katrina]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock receives an award for her support to charities|url=http://www.theyarenews.com/eng/2012/5/14/sandra-bullock-receives-award-support-charities-3788.asp|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150504202455/http://www.theyarenews.com/eng/2012/5/14/sandra-bullock-receives-award-support-charities-3788.asp|dead-url=yes|archive-date=May 4, 2015|accessdate=July 25, 2014|work=.theyarenews.com|date=May 14, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock Wins Favorite Humanitarian at 2013 People's Choice Awards|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/sandra-bullock-wins-favorite-humanitarian-at-2013-peoples-choice-awards-2013101|accessdate=July 25, 2014|publisher=US Weekly|date=January 10, 2013}}</ref>
== Personal life == [[File:Sandra Bullock 2011 AA.jpg|thumb|upright|Bullock at the [[83rd Academy Awards]] in February 2011]] ===Relationships=== Bullock was once engaged to actor [[Tate Donovan]], whom she met while filming ''[[Love Potion No. 9 (film)|Love Potion No. 9]]''. Their relationship lasted three years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20101321,00.html|title=Speeding Bullock}}</ref> She previously dated football player [[Troy Aikman]], and actors [[Matthew McConaughey]] and [[Ryan Gosling]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.boston.com/ae/movies/articles/2010/03/18/private_drama_plagues_oscar_winner_sandra_bullock/ |title=Private drama plagues Oscar winner Sandra Bullock |work=Boston Globe |date=March 18, 2010 |accessdate=June 5, 2010 | first=Sandy | last=Cohen}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/film/praising-private-ryan/2007/04/25/1177459784728.html |title=Praising Private Ryan |work=The Sydney Morning Herald |date=April 27, 2007 |accessdate=June 5, 2010}}</ref>
Bullock married motorcycle builder and ''[[Monster Garage]]'' host [[Jesse James (customizer)|Jesse James]] on July 16, 2005. They first met when Bullock arranged for her ten-year-old godson to meet James as a Christmas present. In November 2009, Bullock and James entered into a custody battle with James' second ex-wife, former adult film actress [[Janine Lindemulder]], with whom James had a child. Bullock and James subsequently won full legal custody of James' five-year-old daughter.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nationalledger.com/artman/publish/article_272628903.shtml |title=Sandra Bullock Custody Battle |work=National Ledger |date=November 7, 2009 |accessdate=November 19, 2009}}</ref>
In March 2010, a scandal arose when several women claimed to have had affairs with James during his marriage to Bullock.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20355742,00.html |title=Jesse James's Alleged Mistress No. 1 to 'Clear the Air' Soon |work=People|date=March 30, 2010 |accessdate=March 31, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20355713,00.html |title=Woman No. 3: I 'Made a Mistake' with Jesse James |work=People|date=March 30, 2010 |accessdate=March 31, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20354852,00.html |title=A Fourth Woman Alleges Affair with Jesse James |work=People|date=March 31, 2010 |accessdate=March 25, 2010}}</ref> Bullock canceled European promotional appearances for ''The Blind Side'' citing "unforeseen personal reasons."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20352311,00.html |title=Sandra Bullock Pulls Out of London Premiere |work=People|date=March 17, 2010 |accessdate=March 31, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20353810,00.html|title=Without Sandra Bullock, Blind Side's Berlin Premiere Canceled |work=People|date=March 23, 2010 |accessdate=March 31, 2010}}</ref> On March 18, 2010, James responded to the rumors of infidelity by issuing a public apology to Bullock. He stated, "The vast majority of the allegations reported are untrue and unfounded … beyond that, I will not dignify these private matters with any further public comment."<ref name="people1">{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20352642,00.html |title=Jesse James Apologizes to Sandra Bullock and His Children |work=People|date=March 18, 2010 |accessdate=March 18, 2010}}</ref> James declared, "There is only one person to blame for this whole situation, and that is me." He asked that Bullock and their children one day "find it in their hearts to forgive me" for their "pain and embarrassment."<ref name="people1"/> James' publicist subsequently announced on March 30, 2010 that James had checked into a rehabilitation facility to "deal with personal issues" and save his marriage to Bullock.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20355899,00.html |title=Jesse James Checks into Treatment Facility |work=People|date=March 30, 2010 |accessdate=March 31, 2010}}</ref> However, on April 28, 2010, it was reported that Bullock had filed for divorce<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/package/article/0,,20364464_20364640,00.html |title=EXCLUSIVE: Sandra Bullock Has Filed for Divorce |work=People|date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=April 28, 2010}}</ref> on April 23 in [[Austin, Texas]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/package/article/0,,20364464_20364883,00.html |title=Sandra Bullock's Divorce Likely Won't Be Messy |work=People|date=April 28, 2010 |accessdate=April 28, 2010}}</ref> Their divorce was finalized on June 28, 2010, with "conflict of personalities" cited as the reason.<ref>{{cite news|author=Abrams, Natalie|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Bullock-James-Divorce-1019990.aspx|title=Sandra Bullock, Jesse James Divorce FInalized|newspaper=[[TV Guide]]|date=June 28, 2010}}</ref>
===Children=== Bullock announced on April 28, 2010 that she had proceeded with plans to adopt a son born in January 2010 in [[New Orleans]], Louisiana.<ref name="PeopleBaby">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/article/0,,20364464_20364639,00.html|title=World Exclusive: Meet Sandra Bullock's Baby Boy!|date=April 28, 2010|work=People|accessdate=April 28, 2010}}</ref> Bullock and James had begun an initial adoption process four months earlier. Bullock's son began living with them in January 2010, but they chose to keep the news private until after the Oscars in March 2010. However, given the couple's separation and then divorce, Bullock continued the adoption of her son as a single parent.<ref name="PeopleBaby"/>
In December 2015, Bullock announced that she had adopted a second child, and appeared on the cover of ''People'' magazine with her then {{frac|3|1|2}}-year-old new daughter.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2015/12/02/sandra-bullock-adopts-daughter-laila/76655260/|title=Sandra Bullock adopts second child|date=December 2, 2015|work=USA Today}}</ref>
===Accidents=== On December 20, 2000, Bullock, who was the only passenger, and the two crew all escaped uninjured in the crash of a chartered business jet. The pilots were unable to [[Pilot-controlled lighting|activate the runway lights]] during a night landing at [[Jackson Hole Airport]] due to the use of out-of-date [[approach plate]]s, but continued the landing anyway. The aircraft landed in the airport's graded safety area between the runway and parallel taxiway and hit a snowbank. The accident caused a separation of the nose cone and landing gear, partial separation of the right wing, and a bend in the left wing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntsb.gov/_layouts/ntsb.aviation/brief.aspx?ev_id=20010105X00028|publisher=NTSB|title=Accident Brief DEN01FA030|date=December 2000}}</ref>
On April 18, 2008, while Bullock was in [[Massachusetts]] shooting the film ''[[The Proposal (2009 film)|The Proposal]]'', she and her then-husband [[Jesse James (customizer)|Jesse James]] were in an [[Sport utility vehicle|SUV]] that was hit head-on (driver's side offset) at moderate speed by a [[driving under the influence|drunken driver]]. Vehicle damage was minor and there were no injuries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thebostonchannel.com/entertainment/15931720/detail.html |title=Sandra Bullock's Car Hit Head-On |publisher=WCVB TV Boston |date=April 19, 2008 |accessdate=April 19, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080421130109/http://www.thebostonchannel.com/entertainment/15931720/detail.html |archivedate=April 21, 2008}}</ref>
=== Legal issues === In October 2004, Bullock won a multimillion-dollar judgment against Benny Daneshjou, the builder of her [[Lake Austin]], [[Texas]] home; the jury ruled that the house was uninhabitable. It has since been torn down and rebuilt.<ref>{{cite news |first=Amy |last=Schatz |title=Actress Bullock sues over Texas land deal|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2001-06-24/business/0106240265_1_actress-sandra-bullock-subdivision-lake-austin |accessdate=September 13, 2014 |work=[[Chicago Tribune]] |agency=[[Knight Ridder]]/Tribune |date=June 24, 2001}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Actress wins $7m for builder's shoddy work |first=Catherine |last=Elsworth |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/1474292/Actress-wins-7m-for-builders-shoddy-work.html|accessdate=September 13, 2014 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |date=October 16, 2004}}</ref> Daneshjou and his insurer later settled with Bullock for roughly half the awarded verdict.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.law360.com/articles/408123/builder-for-sandra-bullock-can-t-revive-malpractice-suit|title=Builder For Sandra Bullock Can't Revive Malpractice Suit}}</ref>
On April 22, 2007, a woman named Marcia Diana Valentine was found lying outside James and Bullock's home in [[Orange County, California]]. When James confronted the woman, she ran to her car, got behind the wheel, and tried to run over him. She was said to be an [[Stalking|obsessed fan]] of Bullock.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lee |first=Ken |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20036964,00.html |title=Cops: Woman Tried to Kill Sandra Bullock's Husband — Jesse James, Sandra Bullock |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=April 26, 2007 |accessdate=April 18, 2010}}</ref> Valentine was charged with one felony count each of aggravated assault and stalking. Bullock obtained a restraining order to bar Valentine from "contacting or coming near her home, family or work for three years".<ref>{{cite news|last=Battistelli|first=L'Oreal|title=Bullock stalker put on notice|url=http://articles.hbindependent.com/2007-05-16/news/hbi-bullock17_1_restraining-sunset-beach-huntington-beach-woman|accessdate=August 30, 2013|newspaper=[[Huntington Beach Independent]] |date=May 16, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/18729381/ |title= Sandra Bullock fan charged with stalking |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=May 17, 2007}}</ref> Valentine pleaded not guilty to charges of aggravated assault and stalking.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.londonnet.co.uk/entertainment/2007/jun/6124_20070613.php |title=Stalker denies attempt to run over Sandra Bullock's husband |publisher=LondonNet |accessdate=April 18, 2010}}</ref> She was subsequently convicted of stalking and sentenced to three years' probation.<ref>{{cite news |first=Leah |last=Chernikoff |title=Sandra Bullock stalker Marcia Valentine sentenced to three years probation |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/gossip/2008/11/13/2008-11-13_sandra_bullock_stalker_marcia_valentine_.html| work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|location=New York |date=November 13, 2008 |accessdate=June 4, 2010}}</ref>
Beginning in 2002, Bullock was also stalked across several states by a man named Thomas James Weldon. In 2003, Bullock obtained a restraining order against him, which was renewed in 2006. After the restraining order expired and Weldon was released from a [[Psychiatric hospital|mental institution]], he again traveled across several states to find Bullock; she then obtained another restraining order.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock Gets Restraining Order Against Thomas James Weldon |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/08/06/sandra-bullock-gets-restr_n_673552.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100823083136/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/08/06/sandra-bullock-gets-restr_n_673552.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=August 23, 2010 |accessdate=August 30, 2013 |newspaper=[[HuffPost]] |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=May 25, 2011 |df=}}</ref>
In June 2014, Joshua James Corbett broke into Bullock's Los Angeles home. Bullock locked herself in a room and dialed 911. Corbett pleaded no contest in 2017 and was sentenced to five years' probation for stalking Bullock and breaking into her residence. He was then subject to a 10-year protective order requiring him to stay away from Bullock. On May 2, 2018, after Corbett missed a court date the previous month, police officers went to his parents' residence where he lived in a guest house to arrest him. When he refused to leave and threatened to shoot officers, a SWAT team was called. After a five-hour standoff, the SWAT team deployed gas canisters and entered the house, where they found Corbett had committed suicide. Corbett's death was the result of "multiple incised wounds" according to the Los Angeles County coroner.<ref>[http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-sandra-bullock-stalker-kills-himself-20180503-story.html ''Los Angeles Times'']</ref>

{{one source|date=April 2012}} [[File:Screen tone example.svg|thumb|Three shapes overlaid with different screentone patterns]] '''Screentone''' is a technique for applying [[Texture (computer graphics)|texture]]s and [[shading|shade]]s to [[drawing]]s, used as an alternative to [[hatching]]. In the conventional process, patterns are transferred to [[paper]] from preprinted sheets,<ref>Sharon Kinsella, ''Adult Manga: Culture and Power in Contemporary Japanese Society'', Routledge, 2000, p59. {{ISBN|0-7007-1003-5}}</ref> but the technique is also simulated in [[computer graphics]]. It is also known by the common brand names Zip-A-Tone (1937, now defunct<ref>Manufacturer-supplied first use date for {{US trademark|71456830 |Zip-A-Tone}}</ref>), Chart-Pak (1949<ref>Manufacturer-supplied first use date for {{US trademark|72055435|Chart-Pak}}</ref>), and Letratone (1966, from [[Letraset]]<ref>Manufacturer-supplied first use date for {{US trademark|72322600|Letratone}}</ref>).
A traditional screentone sheet consists of a flexible transparent backing, the printed texture, and a [[wax]] [[adhesive]] layer. The sheet is applied to the paper, adhesive down, and rubbed with a stylus on the backing side. The backing is then peeled off, leaving the [[ink]] adhered to the paper where pressure was applied.
==Motivation== {{multiple image | width = 107 | image1 = LoveLorn54pp24.jpg | alt1 = | image2 = Lovelorn54pp25.png | alt2 = | footer = Screentone was frequently used in 1950s American [[Comic book|comics]]. }} A screentone saves an artist's time by allowing quick application of textures to [[line art]] where a hand-shaded area would not be reproduced in a timely or acceptable manner. Much like [[halftone]], the size and spacing of black dots, lines, or hatches determine how light or dark an area will appear. Visual artists need to take into account how much an image will be reduced when prepared for publication when choosing the [[Dot pitch|pitch]] of a screentone. Screentones can also be layered to produce [[interference pattern]]s such as [[moire effect]]s, or to simulate multiple sources of shadow in an image.
==Styles== Different styles of screentone exist, variously intended to depict clothing, clouds, emotions, backgrounds, [[image gradient|gradients]] and even objects such as trees. While the sheets are most commonly produced with black ink, there are also varieties in solid and patterned colors. Screentones can also be modified by lightly scratching the backing with an [[X-Acto]] blade to produce [[Starburst (symbol)|starburst]]s and other special effects. [[File:Manga screentone.svg|thumb|Manga screentone]] Screentones are widely used by illustrators and artists, especially for [[cartoon]]s and [[advertising]]. Use of the original medium has been declining since the advent of [[graphics software]] and [[desktop publishing]], but it is still used, for example in [[manga]].
While computer graphics software provides a variety of alternatives to screentone, its appearance is still frequently simulated, to achieve consistency with earlier work or avoid the appearance of computer-generated images. It is sometimes accomplished by [[image scanner|scanning]] actual screentone sheets, but original vector or bitmap screen patterns are also used.
==See also== * [[Ben-Day dots]] *[[Stippling]] *[[Grayscale]] *[[Dithering]]

{{Infobox artist | bgcolour = #EEDD82 | name = Seyyid Kasim Gubari | image = Blaue Moschee Kuppel schräg.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Islamic calligraphy on the dome and interior of the Sultan Ahmed Mosque | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Ottoman Empire]] | death_date = 1615/1616 | death_place = Ottoman Empire | field = [[Islamic calligraphy]] | movement = [[Thuluth]] and [[Naskh (script)|Naskh]] | works = | patrons = | influenced by = | influenced = }} '''Seyyid Kasim Gubari''' of [[Diyarbakır]] was a 17th-century Ottoman artist, noted for his poetic writing and calligraphy. He is celebrated as one of the most accomplished calligraphers of his time and decorated a number of important public buildings including the Blue Mosque in Istanbul.
==Life and work== Seyyid Kasim Gubari's date of birth is not known, but he lived in Diyarbakır in south-eastern (modern day) Turkey on the banks of the Tigris River. He was a direct descendant of the prophet, Mohammed which entitled him to use the appellation ''Seyyid''.<ref>Hueseyin Ayvansaray-i, H., ''The Garden of the Mosques: Hafiz Hüseyin Al-Ayvansarayî's Guide to the Muslim Monuments of Ottoman Istanbul'' Brill, 2000, p. 22</ref> Born Cherif 'Abdallah, he was given the nickname of Gubari (or Ghobâri) because according to legend, he wrote, in ghobar writing, an entire chapter of the Q'ran, consisting of four verses and fifteen words, on a single grain of rice.<ref>Huart, C., ''Les Calligraphes et les Miniaturistes de l'Orient Musulman'', 1972, p. 123 [https://archive.org/details/lescalligraphes00huargoog Digital copy (in French)]-</ref>
He was originally known for his poetic writing and took up calligraphy and decorative inscription sometime later. He responsible for much of the [[Persian calligraphy|calligraphy]] in the dome of the [[Sultan Ahmed Mosque]] (the "Blue Mosque") in [[Istanbul]]. He was also commissioned to write verses from the [[Quran]] throughout the mosque.<ref>"The Blue Mosque", ''National Geographic'', [https://www.nationalgeographic.org/photo/9moorishart-mosque/ Online:]; "Architecture of the [Blue] Mosque, [http://www.sultanahmetcamii.org/architecture-of-the-mosque/ Online"]</ref> He was celebrated as one the greatest calligraphers of his day.<ref>"The Blue Mosque: Jewel of Istanbul" ''The Miracle'', 17 March, 2017, [https://www.pressreader.com/canada/the-miracle/20170317/282119226355783 Online:]</ref>
He died in 1615/1616 and is buried near the tomb of Eyyub.<ref>Hueseyin Ayvansaray-i, H., ''The Garden of the Mosques: Hafiz Hüseyin Al-Ayvansarayî's Guide to the Muslim Monuments of Ottoman Istanbul'' Brill, 2000, p. 22</ref>
==See also== * [[Culture of the Ottoman Empire]] * [[Islamic calligraphy]] * [[List of Ottoman calligraphers]] * [[Turkish art|Ottoman art]]

The '''Studiolo of the Palazzo Belfiore''' was a former [[study (room)|study]], or room for intellectual pursuits, that was once found in a razed [[Renaissance architecture]] palace in [[Ferrara]], region of [[Emilia-Romagna]], Italy. While the palace has disappeared, records do list the paintings, consisting of depictions of muses, that hung in the room. These secular works are now dispersed across museums, but their collective presences recall the renewed attention of Renaissance patrons to symbols from classic mythology.
The palace, like the [[Palazzo Schifanoia]], is described now a ''delizia'' of the [[House of Este|Este dynasty]], which are now considered semi-rural palaces for the enjoyment of ''delights''. The palace was commissioned in 1447 by [[Leonello d'Este]] but completed by [[Borso d'Este]] around 1463. The exact layout of the palace, located near the church of [[Santa Maria degli Angeli, Ferrara|Santa Maria degli Angeli]] is unknown, since in 1483, it was severely damaged by the besieging Venetian armies, and a fire in 1683 completed the destruction.
==Description== Leonello had commissioned the Studiolo dedicated to the [[Muses]].<ref>[http://old.castelloestense.it/delizie/ita/paesaggio/scomparse_ferrara.html Castello Estense] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150222223913/http://old.castelloestense.it/delizie/ita/paesaggio/scomparse_ferrara.html |date=2015-02-22 }}, notes on delizie of Este family.</ref>
The decorative layout of the room was conceived by [[Guarino Veronese]], a tutor of Lionello, In 1447, Guarino mailed Lionello a description of the allegorical figures. By 1449, the palace had the paintings of Clio and Melpomene. Decoration of the studio continued after the death of tutor and pupil, and the program underwent modifications. The intarsia walls were destroyed along with the palace. Eight of the nine canvases are now attributed to this room: #''[[Erato]]'' (love poetry); attributed to [[Angelo Maccagnino]] and follower of [[Cosmè Tura]], Pinacoteca nazionale di Ferrara #''[[Urania]]'' (astronomy); anonymous, Pinacoteca nazionale di Ferrara #''[[Terpsichore]]'' (dance); [[Angelo Maccagnino]] and [[Cosmè Tura]], Museo Poldi Pezzoli, Milan #''[[Thalia (Muse)|Thalia]]'' (comedy and pastoral poetry); [[Michele Pannonio]], [[Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest]] #''[[Euterpe]]'' (flutes and lyric poetry); anonymous Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest #''[[Melpomene]]'' (tragedy); anonymous, Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest #''[[Polyhymnia]]'' (sacred poetry); anonymous, [[Gemäldegalerie, Berlin]] #''[[Calliope]]'' (epic poetry) [[Cosmè Tura]], [[National Gallery, London]]
Supposedly the iconography parallels a bas-relief (1454-1456) depicted by [[Agostino di Duccio]] in the [[Tempio Malatestiano]] of Rimini.
<gallery perrow=4> Studiolo di belfiore, erato di angelo maccagnino e collaboratori di cosmè tura.jpg|Erato Studiolo di belfiore, urania di angelo maccagnino e collaboratori di cosmè tura.jpg|Urania Studiolo di belfiore, tersicore di angelo maccagnino e collaboratori di cosmè tura, museo poldi pezzoli.jpg|Terpsichore Studiolo di belfiore, thalia di michele pannonio, budapest 2.jpg|Thalia Studiolo di belfiore, euterpe di anonimo ferrarese, budapest.jpg|Euterpe Studiolo di belfiore, melpomene di anonimo ferrarese, budapest.jpg|Melpomene 1455-60 Muse Polyhymnia anagoria.JPG|Polyhymnia Cosmè Tura - A Muse (Calliope?) - WGA23142.jpg|Calliope </gallery>

{{for|the short story by Tobias Wolff|Hunters in the Snow (short story)}} {{Infobox Artwork | image_file = Pieter Bruegel the Elder - Hunters in the Snow (Winter) - Google Art Project.jpg | image_size = 300px | title = The Hunters in the Snow | artist = [[Pieter Bruegel the Elder]] | year = 1565 | type = Oil on wood panel | height_metric = 117 | width_metric = 162 | height_imperial = 46 | width_imperial = {{frac|63|3|4}} | metric_unit = cm | imperial_unit = in | city = [[Vienna]], Austria | museum = [[Kunsthistorisches Museum]] }}
'''''The Hunters in the Snow''''' ({{lang-nl|Jagers in de Sneeuw}}), also known as '''''The Return of the Hunters''''', is a 1565 oil-on-wood painting by [[Pieter Bruegel the Elder]]. The [[Dutch and Flemish Renaissance painting|Northern Renaissance]] work is one of a series of works, five of which still survive, that depict different times of the year. The painting is in the collection of the [[Kunsthistorisches Museum]] in [[Vienna]], [[Austria]]. This scene is set in the depths of winter during December/January.
==Background and origins== ''The Hunters in the Snow'', and the series to which it belongs, are in the medieval and early Renaissance tradition of the [[Labours of the Months]]: depictions of various rural activities and work understood by a spectator in Breugel's time as representing the different months or times of the year.
==Description and composition== The painting shows a wintry scene in which three hunters are returning from an expedition accompanied by their dogs. By appearances the outing was not successful; the hunters appear to trudge wearily, and the dogs appear downtrodden and miserable. One man carries the "meager corpse of a [[fox]]" illustrating the paucity of the hunt. In front of the hunters in the snow are the footprints of a rabbit or hare - which has escaped or been missed by the hunters. The overall visual impression is one of a calm, cold, overcast day; the colors are muted whites and grays, the trees are bare of leaves, and wood smoke hangs in the air. Several adults and a child prepare food at an inn with an outside fire. Of interest are the jagged mountain peaks which do not exist in Belgium or Holland.
The landscape itself is a flat-bottomed valley (a river meanders through it) with jagged peaks visible on the far side. A [[watermill]] is seen with its wheel frozen stiff. In the distance, figures [[ice skate]], play hockey with modern style sticks and [[curling|curl]] on a frozen lake; they are rendered as silhouettes.
==Interpretation and reception== {{external media | width = 210px | align = right | headerimage=[[File:Jäger im Schnee - Gebirge und Burg.jpg|210px]] | video1 = [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pj3HdzOR2pY Pieter Bruegel the Elder, ''Hunters in the Snow'' (Winter), 1565], [[Smarthistory]]}} The 1560s was a time of religious revolution in the Netherlands, and Bruegel (and possibly his patron) may be attempting to portray an ideal of what country life used to be or what they wish it to be.
Writing in the "opinion" section of ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'', art historian [[Martin Kemp (art historian)|Martin Kemp]] points out that [[Old Master]]s are popular subjects for [[Christmas cards]] and states that "probably no 'secular' subject is more popular than ... ''Hunters in the Snow''".<ref name="kemp 2008">{{cite journal| doi=10.1038/456876a| last=Kemp| first=Martin| title=Looking at the face of the Earth|journal=Nature|date=December 2008| volume=456|issue=18| pages=876}}</ref>
''Hunters in the Snow'' is used extensively in Russian director [[Andrei Tarkovsky]]'s films ''[[Solaris (1972 film)|Solaris]]'' (1972) and ''[[The Mirror (1975 film)|The Mirror]]'' (1974), and in [[Lars von Trier]]'s 2011 film ''[[Melancholia (2011 film)|Melancholia]]''. It appears also in [[Alain Tanner]]'s film ''[[Dans la ville blanche]]'' (1983). It was an inspiration for [[Roy Andersson]]'s 2014 film ''[[A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence]]'', and it is the basis for the first frame of [[Abbas Kiarostami#2010s|Abbas Kiarostami]]'s ''[[24 Frames (film)|24 Frames]]'' (2017).
The surviving ''Months of the Year cycle'' are: <gallery> File:Pieter Bruegel de Oude - De sombere dag (vroege voorjaar).jpg|''[[The Gloomy Day]]'' File:Pieter Bruegel the Elder- The Harvesters - Google Art Project.jpg|''[[The Harvesters (painting)|The Harvesters]]'' File:Die Heuernte.jpg|''[[The Hay Harvest]]'' File:Pieter Bruegel the Elder - Hunters in the Snow (Winter) - Google Art Project.jpg|''The Hunters in the Snow'' File:Pieter Bruegel (I) - The Return of the Herd (1565).jpg|''[[The Return of the Herd]]'' </gallery>
==References== {{commons category|The Hunters in the Snow}} {{reflist}} * [http://www.khm.at Kunsthistorisches Museum website] * [http://www.googleartproject.com/collection/kunsthistorisches-museum-vienna-museum-of-fine-arts/artwork/hunters-in-the-snow-winter-pieter-bruegel-the-elder/676859/ ''Hunters in the snow'' painting on Google Art Project]

{{Infobox Treaty | name = UNIDROIT Convention on Stolen or Illegally Exported Cultural Objects | long_name = | image = | caption = | type =Self-executing | date_drafted = | date_signed = June 24, 1995 | location_signed = [[Rome]], [[Italy]] | date_sealed = | date_effective = July 1, 1998<ref name="effective">{{cite web|url=http://www.unidroit.org/english/implement/i-95.pdf | title=Status of the UNIDROIT Convention on Stolen or Illegally Exported Cultural Objects| accessdate=2012-07-07 }}</ref> | condition_effective = 5 ratifications (Art. 12) | date_expiration = | ratifiers = 28<ref name="effective"/> | parties = 28<ref name="effective"/><ref>https://treaties.un.org/Pages/showDetails.aspx?objid=08000002800617f5&clang=_en</ref> | depositor = Italian Government | language =Authoritative in English and French | languages = | website = | wikisource = |image_size=200px}}
'''UNIDROIT Convention on Stolen or Illegally Exported Cultural Objects''' (Rome, 1995) is the international treaty on the subject of cultural property protection. It attempts to strengthen the main weaknesses of the 1970 UNESCO ''Convention on the Means of Prohibiting and Preventing the Illicit Import, Export and Transfer of Ownership of Cultural Property''. The [[UNIDROIT]] Convention seeks to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property by modifying the buyer's behaviour, obliging him/her to check the legitimacy of their purchase.
==Due diligence and Burden of Proof== [[File:Claude monet - marina (MCM-RJ) 01.JPG|thumb|[[Claude Monet]]. ''Marina''. Painting stolen from the {{Interlanguage link multi|Museu da Chácara do Céu|pt}}, Rio de Janeiro, in 2006]]
The Convention states that if a cultural property was stolen it must be returned (Chapter II, Art. 3.1).<ref name="Convention">{{cite web|url=http://www.unidroit.org/instruments/cultural-property/1995-convention|title=''UNIDROIT Convention on stolen or illegally exported cultural objects''|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=UNIDROIT official website|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=2017-06-26}}</ref> Any possessor deprived of his/her property will be compensated only if he/she can prove due diligence at the time of the purchase (Chapter II, Art. 4.1). The criteria for due diligence is listed under Article 4.4. of the Convention.
To assess the legitimacy of the object's origin, art market players can use international and national databases dedicated to cultural property protection, for instance, the INTERPOL Stolen Works of Art Database<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.interpol.int/Crime-areas/Works-of-art/Database|title=Works of art / Works of art / Crime areas / Internet / Home - INTERPOL|last=|first=|date=2017-07-26|website=|publisher=Interpol.int|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=2017-06-26}}</ref> collects information about stolen cultural property and issues identification numbers to cultural objects.
Whereas Chapter II of the Convention deals with stolen cultural objects, Chapter III contemplates the export of cultural property in violation of national export restrictions. A State Party can request the competent Court of another Contracting State to order the return of a cultural object illegally exported from its territory if the removal of the object caused detriment in one of the ways listed under Article 5.3. Again, the burden of proof is on the possessor to demonstrate that he/she "neither knew nor ought reasonably to have known at the time of acquisition that the object had been illegally exported" (Art. 6.1).
These rules apply equally to cultural objects inherited or received as gifts. Either an heir or a beneficiary has the same responsibility as a buyer. Therefore, museums and other public institutions must carry out checks over the origin of donated objects.<ref name="overview">{{cite web|url=http://www.unidroit.org/english/conventions/1995culturalproperty/1995culturalproperty-overview-e.pdf | title=The 1995 UNIDROIT Convention on Stolen or Illegally Exported Cultural Objects. An overview | publisher= UNIDROIT official website| accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref>
==The 1970 UNESCO Convention and the 1995 UNIDROIT Convention==
The UNESCO ''Convention on the Means of Prohibiting and Preventing the Illicit Import, Export and Transfer of Ownership of Cultural Property'' (1970 UNESCO Convention) and the UNIDROIT Convention are compatible and complementary. As distinct from the UNESCO Convention, the UNIDROIT Convention focuses on the recovery of cultural property. The UNIDROIT Convention establishes conditions for claims of restitution/return of stolen or illegally exported cultural objects respectively.
Although the UNIDROIT Convention follows key terminology of 1970 UNESCO Convention, cultural goods do not need to be defined as such by the State.
Furthermore, the term "cultural property" is replaced by a more comprehensive "cultural object", but the list of their categories remains the same. The concept of "illicit export" is replaced by "illegal export", which references a prohibitive law rather than a general forbiddance.
==Time Restrictions to Claims for Repatriation== [[File:De Grashaven.jpg|thumb|[[Matthias Withoos]]. ''De Grashaven''. Stolen from [[Westfries Museum]], [[Hoorne]], in 2005]]
The Convention regulates the time period that an affected party may bring a claim for the restitution of stolen cultural property or the return of those illegally exported. Such a claim may be brought in three years from the time when the claimant knew the location of the cultural property and the identity of the possessor and in 50 years since the time of the theft (Art. 3.3). However, there are exceptions to this rule for stolen objects. Cultural objects that form an integral part of an identified monument or archaeological site, or which belong to a public collection are not subject to time limitation other than a period of three years (Art. 3.4). In addition, a Contracting State may declare that a claim warrants an extended time limit of 75 years or longer if so stated in its national law (Art. 3.5).<ref name="convention">{{cite web|url=http://www.unidroit.org/english/conventions/1995culturalproperty/1995culturalproperty-e.pdf | title=UNIDROIT Convention on stolen or illegally exported cultural objects | publisher= UNIDROIT official website| accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref>
The UNIDROIT Convention is not a retroactive treaty. Its provisions only apply to cultural property stolen or illegally exported after the Convention entered into force (Art. 10).<ref name="convention"/> However the UNIDROIT Convention "does not in any way legitimise any illegal transaction of whatever which has taken place before the entry into force of this Convention" and does not "limit any right of a State or other person to make a claim under remedies available outside the framework" of the Convention (Art. 10.3).<ref name="convention"/>

[[File:Dead Drops by Aram Bartholl sthemessage in Kunstenlab (6636685395).jpg|thumb|One of [[Aram Bartholl]]'s USB dead drops]] A '''USB dead drop''' is a [[USB]] mass storage device installed in a [[public space]]. For example, a [[USB flash drive]] might be mounted in an outdoor brick wall and fixed in place with fast concrete.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deaddrops.com/dead-drops/participate/ |title=How to make your own |publisher=Deaddrops.com |date=2013-06-10 |accessdate=2013-06-25}}</ref> Members of the public are implicitly invited to find files, or leave files, on a dead drop by directly plugging their [[laptop]] into the wall-mounted [[USB stick]] in order to transfer data. (It is also possible to use [[smartphone]]s and [[tablet computer|tablet]]s for this purpose, by utilizing a [[USB On-The-Go|USB on-the-go]] cable.) The dead drops can therefore be regarded as an anonymous, offline, [[peer-to-peer]] [[file sharing]] network. However, in practice USB dead drops are [[USB dead drop#Comparison to other types of data transfer|often used for social or artistic reasons]], rather than for practical ones.
==Background and history== The Dead Drops project was conceived by [[Berlin]]-based conceptual artist [[Aram Bartholl]], a member of New York's [[Fat lab]] art and technology collective. The first USB dead drop network of five devices was started by Bartholl in October 2010 in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/shortcuts/2015/mar/08/dead-drops-what-to-do-if-you-see-a-usb-stick-sticking-out-of-a-wall|title=Dead Drops: what to do if you see a USB stick sticking out of a wall|last=Hern|first=Alex|date=8 March 2015|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=9 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-1326177/Dead-Drops-Bizarre-new-artwork-embeds-USB-sticks-buildings.html|title=Dead Drops: Bizarre new artwork embeds USB sticks in buildings|date=3 November 2010|work=[[Mail Online]]}}</ref><ref>https://gizmodo.com/5677377/theres-a-usb-stick-in-my-brick-wall</ref> The name comes from the [[dead drop]] method of [[espionage]] communication. An unrelated system called "deadSwap," in which participants use an SMS gateway to coordinate passing USB memory sticks on to one another, was begun in [[Germany]] in 2009.<ref>http://deadswap.net/files/deadswap.pdf</ref>
Each dead drop is typically installed without any data on the drive, except two files:<ref name="instructables.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.instructables.com/id/Create-a-USB-Dead-Drop-in-Nature/?ALLSTEPS|title=Create a USB Dead Drop in Nature - All|publisher=}}</ref> deaddrops-manifesto.txt,<ref>http://deaddrops.com/download/deaddrops-manifesto.txt</ref> and a [[readme.txt]] file explaining the project.<ref>http://deaddrops.com/download/readme.txt</ref> Although typically found in urban areas embedded in concrete or brick since 2010, installation of USB dead drop into trees<ref name=computerworld_2013/> and other types of bodies in natural settings has also been mentioned since at least 2013.<ref name="instructables.com"/><ref>http://www.al.com/news/birmingham/index.ssf/2015/02/there_was_a_secret_usb_drive_h.html</ref> [[Wireless]] dead drops such as the 2011 [[PirateBox]], where the user connects to a [[wifi hotspot]] with [[network attached storage|local storage]] rather than physically connects to a USB device, have also been created.<ref>{{cite web | title= PirateBox | url= http://wiki.daviddarts.com/PirateBox | archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20110129205033/http://wiki.daviddarts.com/PirateBox | dead-url= yes | archive-date= 2011-01-29 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | title= WIDROP | url= http://widrop.bzhack.org/ | deadurl= yes | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110514001303/http://widrop.bzhack.org/ | archivedate= 2011-05-14 | df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web| title= Wireless drop |url= https://deaddrops.com/db/?page=view&id=465}}</ref>
==Comparison to other types of data transfer== Some of the advantages of utilizing USB dead drops are practical in nature: they permit [[Peer-to-peer|P2P]] file sharing without needing any internet or cellular connection, sharing files with another person secretly/anonymously, and they record no [[IP address]] or similar [[personally identifying information]]. Other benefits are more social or artistic in nature: USB dead drops are an opportunity to practice "[[Telecomix#Datalove|datalove]]" and can be seen as a way to promote [[off-grid]] data networks. The motive to utilize USB dead drops has been compared to what drives people involved in [[geocaching]], which has been around for much longer and is somewhat similar in that often a set of GPS coordinates is used to locate a particular USB dead drop,<ref name=arstechnica_2016/> in particularly that USB dead drops give the user "the thrill of discovery"<ref name=vocative_2015/> both in seeking out the location of the dead drop, and then also in addition when examining the data it contains.
===Potential drawbacks to users=== Dead drops are USB-based devices, which must be connected to an upstream computer system (laptop or smartphone or similar). The act of making such a connection, to a device which is not necessarily trusted, inherently poses certain threats: * [[Malware]]:<ref>http://blogs.discovermagazine.com/discoblog/2010/11/02/usb-ports-on-new-york-citys-streets-plug-in-if-you-dare/</ref> anyone can intentionally or unintentionally store malware on it that can infect an attached computer with malware such as a [[Trojan horse (computing)|trojan horse]], [[Keystroke logging|keylogger]] or [[Firmware#Security risks|proprietary firmware]]. This risk can be mitigated by using [[antivirus software]], or by using a [[burner phone|throwaway device]] for the act of data-transfer. * [[Booby trap]]: a fake dead drop or [[USB Killer]] might be rigged up to electrically damage any equipment connected to it, and/or constitute a health and safety hazard for potential users. This risk can be mitigated by using a USB [[galvanic isolation]] adapter, which allows data exchange while physically decoupling the two circuits. Wifi-based dead drops do not suffer from this threat. * [[Mugging (robbery)|Mugging]]: because a USB dead drop is normally in a public or quasi-public location, it is possible for the location itself to be watched, and users of the dead drop attacked when they attempt to use the system. (Compare with the risk of being mugged at night near an [[Automated teller machine|ATM]] outside a bank which is higher than the risk of being mugged during the day at the teller window inside the bank. Thieves target ATM users because they know most people are withdrawing money, which can then be stolen; thieves can also target USB dead drops, because they know that using one requires a laptop or similar [[consumer electronics]] device.)
===Drawbacks to the system infrastructure=== Publicly and privately available USB dead drops give anyone (with physical access) the ability to save and transfer data anonymously and free of charge. These features are advantages over [[the internet]] and the [[cellular network]], which are at best quasi-anonymous and low-cost (there is always some fee associated although in certain scenarios such as government-subsidized or employer-subsidized or public-library-subsidized network access the enduser may experience [[indirect costs|no direct costs]]). However, offline networks are vulnerable to various types of threats and disadvantages, relative to online ones: * One device at a time: Users cannot plug in to a USB dead drop if someone else is already plugged in * Removal of stored data: anyone with physical access can erase all of the data held within the USB dead drop (via [[file deletion]] or [[disk formatting]]), or make it unusable by encrypting the data or the whole drive and hiding the key (see also the related topic of [[ransomware]]). * Removal of the entire device: thieves can steal the USB drive itself.<ref>http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/miamis-dead-drop-art-project-failing-because-thieves-keep-stealing-public-usb-drives-6537986</ref> * Disclosure: anyone can disclose the location of a (formerly) private dead drop, by shadowing people that use it, and publishing coordinates in a public fashion. This impacts the anonymous nature of USB dead drops, since known drops can be [[CCTV camera|filmed]] or otherwise observed. * [[Vandalism]] of the dead drop by physical destruction: anyone with physical access can destroy the dead drop by using for instance [[pliers]] or a [[hammer]], by high voltage from a static field, with high temperature from a blowtorch, or other methods of physical force. It is possible to make the USB key more difficult to vandalize or to extract, by sealing it in a hole deeper than the length of the USB key (at least 2 cm more), but this requires legitimate users to connect with a USB [[Extension cable|extender cable]]. For clarity, sometimes the installation of the dead-drop can itself be vandalism of the building; when a building owner destroys a dead drop placed without permission, they are not vandalizing the dead drop, but removing a device placed without their leave. Even when a device is placed legally, the device itself is vulnerable to third-party vandalism. * [[Hazards of outdoor recreation#Inclement weather|Exposure to the elements]]: dead drops tend to be exposed to [[precipitation|rain and snow]], which will presumably reduce their [[MTBF|service lifetime]].<ref name=arstechnica_2016>https://arstechnica.com/business/2016/04/on-the-hunt-for-dead-drops-the-offline-anonymous-information-network/</ref> * [[Demolition]] or damage during maintenance: certain dead drop locations are limited to the lifespan of public structures. When a dead drop is embedded in a brick wall, the drop can be destroyed when the wall is destroyed. When a drop is embedded in a concrete sidewalk, the drop can be destroyed by sidewalk-related construction and maintenance. Sometimes dead drops are damaged when walls are repainted.<ref name=vocative_2015/>
==Prevalence== As of 2013, there were more than one thousand known USB dead drops (plus six known wifi-based dead drops).<ref name=computerworld_2013>http://www.computerworld.com/article/2597815/data-center/dead-drops-offline-p2p-file-sharing-network-goes-global.html</ref> Countries which have large numbers of USB dead drops include the [[United States]] and several in [[Europe]].<ref name=computerworld_2013/> As of 2016, it was estimated that the overall dead drop infrastructure contained more than ten [[terabyte]]s of storage capacity, with the majority still in the [[United States]] and [[Europe]], but also with significant numbers of devices reportedly installed in the [[Asia]]/[[Australia|Pacific]] region, [[South America]], and [[Africa]].<ref>http://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias/2016/04/160331_tecnologia_proyecto_dead_drops_usb_muros_red_offline_aram_bartholl_lb</ref><ref name=vocative_2015>http://www.vocativ.com/tech/internet/odd-world-usb-dead-drops/</ref>
